as the latitude increases, the departure between two meridians decreases.
departure is independent of difference of longitude.

jxXsXc0P.question: In which statement is the 'Mean Sun' best described?

options.text: The mean sun is a fictitious sun travelling along the celestial equator at uniform speed.
The mean sun is a fictitious sun travelling along the ecliptic at uniform speed.
The mean sun is a fictitious sun, the orbit of which coincides with that of the apparent sun, but is corrected for mean astronomical and atmospheric refraction.
The mean sun is a fictitious sun, the orbit of which coincides with that of the apparent sun, but is corrected for the mean difference in hour angle.
to describe a situation or relationship concerning the stars.
to describe how two positions of heavenly bodies are located sideways on the sky.
to describe conditions with reference to the Moon.
to describe the time interval between two successive transits of the real apparent Sun at the same meridian.

is introduced by setting the standard time forward by one hour.
is used to extend the sunlight period in the evening.

		<tr>
			<td style="width: 154px;">Departure time and date:
			<td style="width: 508px;">03:00 UTC, 19th November
		</tr>
		<tr>

			<td style="width: 508px;">12 hours 30 minutes
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td style="width: 154px;">New Zealand ST:
			<td style="width: 508px;">UTC + 12 hours
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td style="width: 154px;">Chile ST:
			<td style="width: 508px;">UTC - 4 hours

peizM1gZ.question: The headquarters (HQ) of an airline is located at Schiphol, Netherlands (52°19'N, 004°46'E, UTC +2 hours). One of its aircraft departs from Quito, Ecuador (00°08'S, 078°21'W, UTC- 5 hours) at 22:30 ST on the 26th August local date and flies to Nairobi, Kenya (01°19'S, 036°56′E, UTC + 3 hours). The flight time is 11 hours 14 minutes. What is the Standard Time (ST) and local date at the airline HQ when the aircraft arrives at its destination?

PgcjsV5Q.question:
The headquarters (HQ) of an airline is located at Schiphol, the Netherlands (52°19'N, 004°46'E, UTC +2 hours).
One of its aircraft departs from Quito, Ecuador (00°08'S, 078°21'W, UTC- 5 hours) at 22:30 ST on the 26th August local date to Nairobi, Kenya (01°19'S, 036°56′E, UTC + 3 hours).
The flight time is 11 hours 14 minutes. What is the Standard Time (ST) and local date at the airline HQ when the aircraft arrives at its destination?
